task_name: Cross-Cell-Type CRE Activity Prediction Model Construction
task_goal: Construct a deep learning model to simultaneously predict the cell-type-specific activity of 200bp cis-regulatory elements (CREs) across three human cell lines: K562, HepG2, and SK-N-SH.
task_requirements: The model should be a deep learning model with a shared convolutional backbone (using weight normalization) and a multi-task branched output. Input sequence length is 200bp, converted to 4-channel One-hot. The backbone should consist of multiple Conv1d layers with Weight Norm to identify DNA motifs. The final output must be a 3-dimensional vector (one for each cell line) predicted via independent branched linear layers to capture cell-type-specific regulatory logic.

task_dataset.description: Dataset containing 200bp DNA sequences and their corresponding MPRA activity scores (l2fc) in three cell lines.
task_dataset.key_constraint: Input: 200bp DNA One-hot (4, 200).The lfcSE means Log Fold Change Standard Error,it should be used to filter out data with lfcSE > 0.5 before training. Metrics: Evaluate performance using Pearson correlation per cell type for specificity validation.
